text:
ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡¹ Austria: Vincent Bueno to Perform "Amen" at Eurovision 2021
“Amen” has been revealed as the title of the Austrian entry for the 2021 Eurovision Song Contest in Rotterdam.
Vincent Bueno will perform the song “Amen” at Eurovision 2021, the song title was announced Eberhard Forcher who works with the Austrian delegation to select the singer and song for Eurovision. The Austrian entry is set to be released on the week commencing March 8.
Speaking with Heute earlier this month, Vincent Bueno dropped his first hint regarding what to expect from his entry for Eurovision 2021 stating, â€œItâ€™s different from my other songs. So not the classic Bueno styleâ€?. Vincent has already recordedÂ his song for the contest having travelled to Zurich, Switzerland last month.
Who is Vincent Bueno?
Vincent Bueno is a 34-year old singer-songwriter from Vienna and is of Filipino descent. He first came to public attention after winning the first series of the ORF musical theatre talent showÂ Musical! Die ShowÂ in 2008. He previously attempted to represent Austria in 2016 with â€œAll We Need is That Loveâ€?, which finished sixth in the Austrian national final. In 2017, he was a backing vocalist for Nathan Trent at the Eurovision Song Contest in Kyiv.
Image Source: ORF
Austria in the Eurovision Song Contest Austria debuted in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1957, Bob Martin represented the country on their debut, but finished in last place scoring just 3 points. The country has gone on to finish last in the contest on 8 occasions. Austria has won the contest on two occasions, the first being in 1966 when Udo JÃ¼rgen performed â€œMerci, Cherieâ€?. It was 48 years later than Austria won again when Conchita Wurst performed â€œRise Like a Phoenixâ€? scoring a total of 290 points.
